name: BADA México 2026
description: The sixth edition of BADA brings together 200+ artists selling directly to collectors with no intermediary. Works priced under 2,500 MXN make this the most accessible art fair during Art Week. Features special guest photographer Lourdes Almeida.

name: Unique Design X 2026
description: Nomadic design fair showcasing functional art and collectible design. This edition focuses on 'the innate, intricate and symbiotic essence of how objects inform how we live.' Features Carpenters Workshop, Marion Friedmann, and local talents.

name: Laguna: Reúso Exhibition
description: Exhibition 'Reúso: arquitectura de casi nada' (Re-use: architecture of almost nothing) featuring fifteen international architecture firms. Set in a beautifully rehabbed 1920s textile factory turned cultural center.

name: OMR Gallery: Leonora Carrington & Marcel Dzama
description: Double exhibition opening at OMR featuring works by surrealist master Leonora Carrington alongside contemporary artist Marcel Dzama. A powerhouse show at one of Mexico City's most iconic galleries.

name: Museo Jumex: Simone Fattal
description: Major exhibition by Lebanese-American artist Simone Fattal, presented in collaboration with Fondation Prince Pierre de Monaco. Known for her ceramic sculptures and paintings exploring mythology and memory.

name: Museo Jumex: Gabriel de la Mora - La Petite Mort
description: Final days to see Gabriel de la Mora's exhibition 'La Petite Mort' exploring themes of transformation and transcendence through found objects and meticulous process-based works.

name: SACBE: Obsidian Butterfly
description: Immersive art and music experience inspired by Mexica cosmology, honoring Itzpapálotl, the Obsidian Butterfly. Features mirror spaces, multiple music stages, ritual spaces, dancers, poetry, and ceremonial offerings throughout the night.

name: BADA Grand Art Auction with Tinieblas
description: Wild art auction in performance format organized by Juan José Díaz Infante, featuring legendary wrestler Tinieblas in a real wrestling ring. A uniquely Mexican art world experience.

name: Galería Hilario Galguera Opening
description: Art Week opening at Galería Hilario Galguera, the gallery that brought Damien Hirst to Latin America. Located in a stunning early 20th century manor in the emerging San Rafael neighborhood.

name: Arróniz Arte Contemporáneo Opening
description: Art Week exhibition opening at one of Roma Norte's leading galleries. Founded in the 1980s, Arróniz has championed Mexican contemporary art from José Luis Cuevas to emerging voices.

name: House of Gaga Opening
description: Art Week opening at House of Gaga in Roma Norte. The gallery has presented significant solo exhibitions and participated in major fairs including Zona Maco.
address: Gobernador Rafael Rebollar 20, San Miguel Chapultepec

name: Marso Gallery Opening
description: Art Week opening reception at Marso, presenting cutting-edge contemporary art. The gallery has been a fixture at Material Art Fair with experimental presentations.

name: QiPO Fair 2026
description: Inclusive art fair outside the commercial circuit featuring artist-run spaces, collectives, and emerging projects from around the world. Includes performances, installations, talks, and screenings.

name: Clavo Movimiento Fair
description: Accessible art fair offering direct contact with artists. Great art at more accessible prices than the larger fairs, opening Friday of Art Week.

name: Museo Anahuacalli - Art Week Programming
description: Special Art Week programming at Diego Rivera's volcanic stone museum housing his pre-Hispanic art collection. Contemporary art exhibitions dialogue with ancient artifacts in this architectural masterpiece.

name: Casa Gilardi Tour
description: Visit Luis Barragán's final residential project (1976), a symphony of saturated hues, precisely directed light, and shimmering water. One of the most iconic examples of emotional architecture.
address: General Antonio León 82, San Miguel Chapultepec

name: Zona Maco Forma: Art Meets Design
description: New section at Zona Maco creating dialogue between contemporary art and design. A curated collaboration exploring the intersection of functional objects and fine art.
address: Av. del Conscripto 311, Lomas de Sotelo

name: Material Art Fair: Immat Performance Program
description: Performance art program at Material Art Fair curated by Michelangelo Miccolis. Experience live performance works by Mexican and international artists throughout the fair.

name: Biennial of the Americas: CultureHop & Brunch at Laguna
description: Friday morning gallery hop and brunch at Laguna cultural center, organized by Biennial of the Americas. Explore art in the stunning converted factory space.

name: Museo Tamayo Gala
description: Annual gala at Museo Tamayo celebrating Art Week. One of the most anticipated social events of the week, combining art and Mexico City's creative community.
address: Paseo de la Reforma 51, Bosque de Chapultepec

name: MUAC - Museo Universitario Arte Contemporáneo
description: Mexico's most important contemporary art museum at UNAM. Visit during Art Week for cutting-edge exhibitions and thought-provoking installations in Teodoro González de León's striking building.

name: Galería Mascota Opening
description: Art Week opening at Mascota, one of Roma Norte's most exciting young galleries. Known for representing emerging and mid-career artists pushing boundaries.
address: General Juan Cano 68, San Miguel Chapultepec

name: Palacio de Bellas Artes Visit
description: Visit Mexico's most important cultural venue, featuring murals by Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros, and José Clemente Orozco. The Art Deco/Art Nouveau building is a masterpiece itself.

name: San Miguel Chapultepec Gallery Walk
description: Gallery walk through San Miguel Chapultepec, home to Kurimanzutto, Labor, House of Gaga, and other major galleries. The neighborhood has become a major art destination.

name: Salón ACME: Puebla State Showcase
description: Special section at Salón ACME featuring artists from Puebla, the 2026 guest state. Curated by art historian Nina Fiocco, showcasing the vibrant art scene outside Mexico City.
